paper_abstract: A topological graph is called k -quasi-planar if it does not contain k pairwise crossing edges. It is conjectured that for every fixed k, the maximum number of edges in a k-quasi-planar graph on n vertices is O(n). We provide an affirmative answer to the case k=4.
paper_title: On the Maximum Number of Edges in Topological Graphs with no Four Pairwise Crossing Edges
